column4: when running a PAE version of Linux in a 32-bit Ubuntu, why would Linux continue to use only 3GB of the 4GB in the machine?
maybe your video card shared your memeory
check the bios setting if you want to close the video share memory
TJ-: that makes sense, though this laptop has a dedicated video card. unfortunately, it uses EFI rather than BIOS, so i don't think there's a way to disable the shared video memory
